narrative=Anna Oliver was last reported missing from the library on Greenside Street, Alloa. Known for frequenting the local community spaces, concerns arose when her friend, Tracey Walker, noticed her absence at a regular gathering. Anna had been planning to attend a choir practice at the church later that day, a routine she seldom missed. Despite being in the company of her colleague, Rebecca Davies, earlier at Kemper Avenue, Falkirk, she did not return home or contact anyone thereafter. The sudden lapse in communication was unusual and raised alarm. Authorities initiated a search which expanded across nearby locations. Anna was eventually found safe by library staff on Dumbarton Road, but the reasons for her unintended detour remain unclear.

narrative=Anna Oliver, recently released from prison, was reported missing after being last seen near Dunhalin, Rumford. She had been at a gathering hosted by her friend at the boat docked there. The friend, along with another attendee Tracey, noticed Anna's absence as they made their way to the historic church nearby for a planned event. Concern grew when Anna didn't arrive at Craigs Terrace, a location familiar from her past. As the search intensified, her colleague Joyce Birch reported that Anna had mentioned exploring an abandoned mine she found intriguing. Authorities, piecing together these events, initiated a search focusing on these locations, leading to her being traced safely days later.
